intro: Tristemma vestitum, commonly known as the velvet tristemma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody stems covered in a dense, velvety layer of hairs. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically white or pale pink and appear in clusters. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface.
